page.title: 05Banwell Fire Station
page.content: Miss Fazakerley died in l887 leaving a building in East Street for use as a village Fire Station. If it stopped being a Fire Station then the building was to be sold and the money divided between the poor of the Parish. So to save the building for the Parish to use as a Museum, the Fire Station must have a Fire Brigade. In l984 a group of people formed the Friends of Banwell Fire Station. Their aim was to run a Museum in the Fire Station building and to raise money for its maintenance. A volunteer fire crew was also formed. On l4th September l985 the Fire Station was reopened after a few years of closure. The opening was followed by a massive Jumble Sale at Church House, all the proceeds were donated to the Fire Station, Â£500 at the last count.
